defmodule BinarySearch do
  def search(list, target) do
    do_search(list, target, 0, length(list) - 1)
  end

  defp do_search(_, _, low, high) when low > high, do: -1
  defp do_search(list, target, low, high) do
    mid = div(low + high, 2)
    case Enum.at(list, mid) do
      ^target -> mid
      val when val > target -> do_search(list, target, low, mid - 1)
      _ -> do_search(list, target, mid + 1, high)
    end
  end
end

main = do
    putStrLn "Enter a number:"
    input <- getLine
    let n = read input :: Int
    let fibs = 0 : 1 : zipWith (+) fibs (tail fibs)

    print $ take n fibs

let rec quicksort = function
  | [] -> []
  | pivot :: rest ->
      let left, right = List.partition ((>) pivot) rest in
      quicksort left @ [pivot] @ quicksort right
let sorted = quicksort [5; 2; 9; 1; 5; 6]

defmodule RateLimiter do
  defstruct [:limit, :count, :reset_time]
  def new(limit, window) do
    %RateLimiter{limit: limit, count: 0, reset_time: now() + window}
  end
  def allow?(limiter) do
    current = now()
    if current > limiter.reset_time do
      {%RateLimiter{limit: limiter.limit, count: 1, reset_time: current + (limiter.reset_time - limiter.count)}, true}
    else
      if limiter.count < limiter.limit do
        {%RateLimiter{limiter | count: limiter.count + 1}, true}
      else
        {limiter, false}
      end
    end
  end
  defp now, do: System.system_time(:millisecond)
end

plot_histogram <- function(data, bins) {
  hist_data <- hist(data, breaks = bins, plot = FALSE)
  plot(hist_data, main = 'Histogram', xlab = 'Value', ylab = 'Frequency', col = 'skyblue')
  abline(v = mean(data), col = 'red', lwd = 2)
  abline(v = median(data), col = 'green', lwd = 2)
  legend('topright', c('Mean', 'Median'), col = c('red', 'green'), lwd = 2)
}

histogram <- function(x, breaks) {
  counts <- table(cut(x, breaks = breaks))
  mids <- as.numeric(sub('.*,(.*)]', '\\1', names(counts))) - diff(breaks)[1] / 2
  barplot(counts, names.arg = mids, xlab = 'Value', ylab = 'Count', col = 'lightgreen')
  lines(density(x), col = 'blue', lwd = 2)
  rug(x, col = 'gray')
}

main = do
    putStrLn "Enter numbers separated by spaces:"
    line <- getLine
    let nums = map read (words line) :: [Int]
    let sorted = foldl (\acc x -> insert x acc) [] nums
    putStrLn $ "Sorted: " ++ show sorted
    where insert x [] = [x]
          insert x (y:ys) = if x <= y then x:y:ys else y:insert x ys

defmodule LRUCache do
  defstruct [:capacity, :map, :list]
  def new(capacity) do
    %LRUCache{capacity: capacity, map: %{}, list: []}
  end
  def put(cache, key, value) do
    new_list = [key | Enum.filter(cache.list, &(&1 != key))]
    new_map = Map.put(cache.map, key, value)
    if length(new_list) > cache.capacity do
      {_, trimmed_list} = List.pop_at(new_list, -1)
      {_, trimmed_map} = Map.pop(new_map, List.last(new_list))
      %LRUCache{cache | map: trimmed_map, list: trimmed_list}
    else
      %LRUCache{cache | map: new_map, list: new_list}
    end
  end
end

type 'a skip_list =
  | Nil
  | Node of 'a * 'a skip_list array
let insert x sl =
  let rec find_levels level lst =
    match lst with
    | Nil -> Array.make (level + 1) Nil
    | Node (v, next) when x <= v -> Array.make (level + 1) Nil
    | Node (v, next) ->
        let sub = find_levels (level - 1) next.(level)
        sub.(level) <- lst; sub
  in
  let levels = find_levels (Random.int 4) sl in
  Node (x, levels)

function stack()
    local s = {}
    s.push = function(x) table.insert(s, x) end
    s.pop = function() return table.remove(s) end
    s.peek = function() return s[#s] end
    return s
end
local st = stack()
st.push(5)

SUBROUTINE reverse_array(arr, n)
    INTEGER, INTENT(IN) :: n
    INTEGER, INTENT(INOUT) :: arr(n)
    INTEGER :: i, temp
    DO i = 1, n/2
        temp = arr(i)
        arr(i) = arr(n - i + 1)
        arr(n - i + 1) = temp
    END DO
END SUBROUTINE

-module(counter).

start() -> spawn(fun() -> loop(0) end).
loop(N) ->
    receive
        {increment} -> loop(N + 1);
        {get, Pid} -> Pid ! N, loop(N)
    end.
increment(Pid) -> Pid ! {increment}.
get(Pid) -> Pid ! {get, self()}, receive N -> N end.

def palindrome?(str : String) : Bool
  cleaned = str.downcase.gsub(/[^a-z0-9]/, "")
  left, right = 0, cleaned.size - 1
  while left < right
    return false if cleaned[left] != cleaned[right]
    left += 1
    right -= 1
  end
  true
end

function is_prime(n)
    if n < 2
        return false
    end
    for i = 2:sqrt(n)
        if n % i == 0
            return false
        end
    end
    return true
end
println(is_prime(17))

proc reverseString(s: string): string =
  result = newString(s.len)
  for i in 0..<s.len:
    result[s.len - 1 - i] = s[i]
  return result

parent(X, Y) :- father(X, Y).
parent(X, Y) :- mother(X, Y).
grandparent(X, Z) :- parent(X, Y), parent(Y, Z).

mother(jane, mary).

class Stack
    private items: ARRAY OF INTEGER
    private top: INTEGER
    feature
        make(n: INTEGER)
            do
                create items.make(0, n-1)
                top := -1
            end
        push(x: INTEGER)
            do
                top := top + 1
                items[top] := x
            end
end

<?hh
function reverse_string(string $s): string {
    $len = strlen($s);
    $result = '';
    for ($i = $len - 1; $i >= 0; $i--) {
        $result .= $s[$i];
    }
    return $result;
}

class Stack
    var items[]
    function push(item)
        items.append(item)
    end
    function pop()
        if items.len() > 0
            return items.pop()
        end
        return null
    end
end
s := Stack()
s.push(5)

    in implode(rev chars)

Sub ReverseString(ByVal s As String)
    Dim result As String
    result = ""
    For i = Len(s) To 1 Step -1
        result = result & Mid(s, i, 1)
    Next i
    MsgBox result
End Sub

Fixpoint factorial (n : nat) : nat :=
  match n with
  | 0 => 1
  | S n' => n * factorial n'
  end.
Compute (factorial 5).

Definition double (n : nat) : nat :=
  n + n.
Fixpoint sum_to (n : nat) : nat :=
  match n with
  | 0 => 0
  | S n' => n + sum_to n'
  end.
Compute (sum_to 5).

Proof.
  intros n; unfold double; reflexivity.
Qed.

let sum_array (a:array int) : int
    requires { a <> null }
    ensures { result = Array.sum a 0 (Array.length a) } =
  let s = ref 0 in
  for i = 0 to Array.length a - 1 do
    s := !s + a[i]
  done;
  !s

function gcd(a, b)
    while b > 0 do
        a, b = b, a % b
    end
    return a
end
print(gcd(48, 18))

def fibonacci(n)
  return [0, 1] if n <= 2
  seq = [0, 1]
  (n - 2).times { seq << seq[-1] + seq[-2] }
  seq
end
puts fibonacci(6).join(', ')

SUBROUTINE matrix_transpose(a, n, m, at)
    INTEGER, INTENT(IN) :: n, m
    REAL, INTENT(IN) :: a(n,m)
    REAL, INTENT(OUT) :: at(m,n)
    INTEGER :: i, j
    DO i = 1, n
        DO j = 1, m
            at(j,i) = a(i,j)
        END DO
    END DO
END SUBROUTINE

-module(timer).
-export([start/1, tick/1]).
start(Duration) -> spawn(fun() -> loop(Duration) end).
loop(Duration) ->
    receive
        tick -> io:format("Tick~n"), loop(Duration - 1)
    after Duration * 1000 -> io:format("Time's up!~n")
    end.
tick(Pid) -> Pid ! tick.

(defn gcd [a b]
  (if (zero? b)
    a
    (recur b (mod a b))))

def fizzbuzz(n : Int32) : Array(String)
  (1..n).map do |i|
    case {i % 3 == 0, i % 5 == 0}
    when {true, true} then "FizzBuzz"
    when {true, false} then "Fizz"
    when {false, true} then "Buzz"
    else i.to_s
    end
  end.to_a
end

function sum_squares(n)
    total = 0
    for i = 1:n
        total += i^2
    end
    return total
end
println(sum_squares(5))

proc transpose[T](m: seq[seq[T]]): seq[seq[T]] =
  result = newSeq[seq[T]](m[0].len)
  for i in 0..<m[0].len:
    result[i] = newSeq[T](m.len)
    for j in 0..<m.len:
      result[i][j] = m[j][i]
  return result

(define (flatten lst)
  (cond ((null? lst) '())
        ((pair? lst) (append (flatten (car lst)) (flatten (cdr lst))))
        (else (list lst))))
(define nested '(1 (2 3) 4))
(printf "Flattened: ~a\n" (flatten nested))

IDENTIFICATION DIVISION.
PROGRAM-ID. Factorial.
DATA DIVISION.
WORKING-STORAGE SECTION.
01 NUM PIC 9(2) VALUE 5.
01 FACT PIC 9(10).
PROCEDURE DIVISION.
    MOVE 1 TO FACT
    PERFORM VARYING I FROM 1 BY 1 UNTIL I > NUM
        COMPUTE FACT = FACT * I
    END-PERFORM
    DISPLAY 'Factorial: ' FACT
    STOP RUN.

factorial(N, F) :- N > 1, N1 is N - 1, factorial(N1, F1), F is N * F1.
factorial(1, 1).
factorial(0, 1).
?- factorial(5, F), write('Factorial: '), write(F), nl.

function fibonacci(n) {
    if (n <= 1) return n;
    return fibonacci(n - 1) + fibonacci(n - 2);
}
for (i = 1; i <= 6; i++) {
    writeOutput(fibonacci(i) & " ");

class Queue
    private items: ARRAY OF INTEGER
    private front, rear: INTEGER
    feature
        make(n: INTEGER)
            do
                create items.make(0, n-1)
                front := 0
                rear := -1
            end
        enqueue(x: INTEGER)
            do
                rear := rear + 1
                items[rear] := x
            end
end

<?hh
function fibonacci(int $n): int {
    if ($n <= 1) {
        return $n;
    }
    return fibonacci($n - 1) + fibonacci($n - 2);
}
